skillTree.localised_description: The dead reach out from the rotten corpse of Navrre with grasping hands and broken teeth to fasten themselves on any living creature they can, dragging those unfortunate souls into the great mass of Navrre's body.

effects.description: Ability: "Corpse Killers"

skillTree.localised_description: Howls and haunting moans spring forth from the corpse trapped within Infanta Leanora Navrre's corrupted form, the screams of her victims once more given voice. Sadly for those despoiled within, their cries do nothing more than wound those who can hear them.

effects.description: Ability: "Screams of the Damned"

target_if: Leadership is lower than 50% of base

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities

skillTree.localised_description: The vengeful Navarre, after being outcast and hunted by the nobles of Estalia for her terrible crimes, dared to bind herself within a Necrofex Colossus and has ravaged her erstwhile domains for more than a century like a Daemon from the night.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -80 with all Southern Realms

skillTree.localised_description: While the Darkness' Daughter might be the Necrofex within which Navrre has bound herself, it is by no means the only one that she has created. Those other, lesser, constructs that follow her are bolstered by her mere presence.

skillTree.localised_description: Necrofex Colossi like Infanta Leanora Navrre are loci of magic, drawing in the dark and violent tendencies of magic and rejecting those of light and life. Any caster who attempts to use those winds in the presence of Darkness' Daughter will find themselves hamstrung.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Darkness' Daughter, a towering behemoth of terror and destruction, is the fearsome embodiment of Infanta Leanora Navarre's bound fury and boundless vengeance. This colossal construct strikes fear into the hearts of all who witness its inexorable advance. Clad in the accursed metal of ancient dreadnoughts, the Darkness' Daughter rises from the depths like a nightmare given form. Its massive frame, towering over even the mightiest ships of war, is adorned with the remnants of its grisly conquests — the shattered hulls and broken bodies of those who dared to oppose it. Upon its skeletal prow, the Figurehead of Desolation looms, a grotesque visage of terror that casts a shadow of despair across the seas. As it marches ever onward, the Darkness' Daughter leaves behind a trail of devastation and despair, its passage marked by the smoldering ruins of cities and the anguished cries of the innocent. None can stand against its inexorable advance, for it is not merely a machine of war, but a living embodiment of the darkness that lurks within the hearts of all.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -40 with all Southern Realms
Upkeep: -20% for Necrofex Colossus units
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Necrofex Colossus units (minimum 1)
Passive ability: "Regeneration" when fighting at sea
Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition

items.colour_text: Forged from ancient bronze, the Figurehead stands as a grotesque fusion of maritime iconography and eldritch horror. The face of the Figurehead is a visage of perpetual agony, frozen in a rictus of despair. Hollow sockets bore into the souls of onlookers, devoid of eyes yet emanating a malevolent presence that seems to pierce through the veil of mortal existence. A palpable aura of darkness envelops the Figurehead, casting a pall of despair over all who dare to gaze upon it. Its very presence seems to drain the warmth from the air, leaving behind a suffocating chill that freezes the hearts of even the bravest souls. Those who behold it speak of an overwhelming sense of hopelessness and dread, as if the Figurehead itself is a harbinger of the world's impending doom.

effects.description: Hit points: +15%
Leadership aura size: +50%
Character's aura leadership effect: +5
Ability: "Figurehead of Desolation"

Enemy leadership: -6
	(enemy armies in local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Darkness' Daughter, a towering behemoth of terror and destruction, is the fearsome embodiment of Infanta Leanora Navarre's bound fury and boundless vengeance. This colossal construct strikes fear into the hearts of all who witness its inexorable advance. Clad in the accursed metal of ancient dreadnoughts, the Darkness' Daughter rises from the depths like a nightmare given form. Its massive frame, towering over even the mightiest ships of war, is adorned with the remnants of its grisly conquests — the shattered hulls and broken bodies of those who dared to oppose it. Upon its skeletal prow, the Figurehead of Desolation looms, a grotesque visage of terror that casts a shadow of despair across the seas. As it marches ever onward, the Darkness' Daughter leaves behind a trail of devastation and despair, its passage marked by the smoldering ruins of cities and the anguished cries of the innocent. None can stand against its inexorable advance, for it is not merely a machine of war, but a living embodiment of the darkness that lurks within the hearts of all.
